page.title: 14Nether Stowey:Amenities
page.content: Eleven years ago a modern Health Centre was built here to serve the growing community. It is very well equipped,having two qualified part time dispensing chemists each managing a dispensary.There are two doctors, two part time nurses and receptionist. Also working from the Centre are a Health Visitor, a District Nurse, and a District Midwife who is shared with the Williton area. The Centre is open every weekday to offer some aspect of health care and until 11am on Saturday mornings. The Library was opened in 1980 in the renovated old village school. There are over 1000 subscribers and more than 6000 books are at their disposal. Books may be borrowed free of charge for a month.The building also houses the Quantock Information Service, a museum display, and a Meeting Room.
